name: ZonalCent
description: A scientific paper that describes a way to use the widely applied DayCent model for the simulation of multi-component agroforestry systems. The approach divides the agroforestry system into different functional zones each containing maximally one crop and on tree. These zones are simulated indepentently. The approach is model independent and could be applied to any agroecosystem model that is capable of simulateneously simulating at least one tree and one crop component.
developers: Moritz Laub, Ulysse Le Goff, Marc Prébandier, Johan Six, Rémi Cardinael
access_barrier: Access to the tool needs to be granted (e.g. tool owner needs to give permission after user registration; tool owner sends tool after receiving a request email)
access_procedure: The approach is free to use and the equations given in the manuscript. But DayCent is property of Colorado state university and would have to be requested from them.
